157 /* These constants are the values used by the GC620 2D engine */
158 #define GC620_NV12 0x104
159 #define GC620_NV21 0x105
160 #define GC620_I420 0x103
161 #define GC620_P010_MSB 0x108
162 #define GC620_I010 0x10A
163 #define GC620_YUYV 0x100
164 #define GC620_UYVY 0x101
165 #define GC620_NV16 0x106
166 #define GC620_RGBA8888 0
167 #define GC620_BGRA8888 4
168 #define GC620_BGRX8888 5
169 #define GC620_ABGR8888 12
170 #define GC620_ARGB8888 15
171 #define GC620_RGB565 3
172 #define GC620_BGR565 11
173 #define GC620_B5G5R5X1 8
174 #define GC620_RGB888_PLANAR 0x10C

177 
178 // XCODER STATE
179 typedef enum
180 {
181  NI_XCODER_IDLE_STATE = 0x00, // Xcoder idle state
182  NI_XCODER_OPEN_STATE = 0x01 << 1, // Xcoder open state
183  NI_XCODER_WRITE_STATE = 0x01 << 2, // Xcoder write state
184  NI_XCODER_READ_STATE = 0x01 << 3, // Xcoder read state
185  NI_XCODER_CLOSE_STATE = 0x01 << 4, // Xcoder close state
186  // Xcoder flush state, flush at the end of stream
187  NI_XCODER_FLUSH_STATE = 0x01 << 5,
188  // Xcoder inter flush state, flush during transcoding stream
189  NI_XCODER_INTER_FLUSH_STATE = 0x01 << 6,
190  NI_XCODER_READ_DESC_STATE = 0x01 << 7, // Xcoder Read Desc state
191  NI_XCODER_HWUP_STATE = 0x01 << 8, // Xcoder HW upload state
192  NI_XCODER_HWDL_STATE = 0x01 << 9, // Xcoder HW download state
193  // Other states, like init, alloc, etc.
194  NI_XCODER_GENERAL_STATE = 0x01 << 10,
195 } ni_xcoder_state_t;
196 
197 typedef enum
198 {
199  NI_PIX_FMT_YUV420P = 0, /* 8-bit YUV420 planar */
200  NI_PIX_FMT_YUV420P10LE = 1, /* 10-bit YUV420 planar */
201  NI_PIX_FMT_NV12 = 2, /* 8-bit YUV420 semi-planar */
202  NI_PIX_FMT_P010LE = 3, /* 10-bit YUV420 semi-planar */
203  NI_PIX_FMT_RGBA = 4, /* 32-bit RGBA packed */
204  NI_PIX_FMT_BGRA = 5, /* 32-bit BGRA packed */
205  NI_PIX_FMT_ARGB = 6, /* 32-bit ARGB packed */
206  NI_PIX_FMT_ABGR = 7, /* 32-bit ABGR packed */
207  NI_PIX_FMT_BGR0 = 8, /* 32-bit RGB packed */
208  NI_PIX_FMT_BGRP = 9, /* 24bit RGB packed */
209  NI_PIX_FMT_NV16 = 10, /* 8-bit YUV422 semi-planar */
210  NI_PIX_FMT_YUYV422 = 11, /* 8-bit YUV422 */
211  NI_PIX_FMT_UYVY422 = 12, /* 8-bit YUV422 */
212  NI_PIX_FMT_8_TILED4X4 = 13, /* 8 bit tiled4x4 */
213  NI_PIX_FMT_10_TILED4X4 = 14,/* 10 bit tiled4x4 */
214  NI_PIX_FMT_NONE = 15, /* invalid format */
215 } ni_pix_fmt_t;
216 
217 #define NI_SCALER_FLAG_IO 0x0001 /* 0 = source frame, 1 = destination frame */
218 #define NI_SCALER_FLAG_PC 0x0002 /* 0 = single allocation, 1 = create pool */
219 #define NI_SCALER_FLAG_PA 0x0004 /* 0 = straight alpha, 1 = premultiplied alpha */
220 #define NI_SCALER_FLAG_P2 0x0008 /* 0 = normal allocation, 1 = P2P allocation */
221 #define NI_SCALER_FLAG_FCE 0x0010 /* 0 = no fill color, 1 = fill color enabled */
222 
223 #define NI_MAX_KEEP_ALIVE_TIMEOUT 100
224 #define NI_MIN_KEEP_ALIVE_TIMEOUT 1
225 #define NI_DEFAULT_KEEP_ALIVE_TIMEOUT 3
226 
227 #define NI_MIN_CUSTOM_SEI_PASSTHRU -1
228 #define NI_MAX_CUSTOM_SEI_PASSTHRU 254
229 #define NI_DISABLE_USR_DATA_SEI_PASSTHRU 0
230 #define NI_ENABLE_USR_DATA_SEI_PASSTHRU 1
231 
232 // Picked from the xcoder firmware, commit e3b882e7
233 #define NI_VPU_CEIL(_data, _align) (((_data)+(_align-1))&~(_align-1))
234 #define NI_VPU_ALIGN4(_x) (((_x)+0x03)&~0x03)
235 #define NI_VPU_ALIGN8(_x) (((_x)+0x07)&~0x07)
236 #define NI_VPU_ALIGN16(_x) (((_x)+0x0f)&~0x0f)
237 #define NI_VPU_ALIGN32(_x) (((_x)+0x1f)&~0x1f)
238 #define NI_VPU_ALIGN64(_x) (((_x)+0x3f)&~0x3f)
239 #define NI_VPU_ALIGN128(_x) (((_x)+0x7f)&~0x7f)
240 #define NI_VPU_ALIGN256(_x) (((_x)+0xff)&~0xff)
241 #define NI_VPU_ALIGN512(_x) (((_x)+0x1ff)&~0x1ff)
242 #define NI_VPU_ALIGN2048(_x) (((_x)+0x7ff)&~0x7ff)
243 #define NI_VPU_ALIGN4096(_x) (((_x)+0xfff)&~0xfff)
244 #define NI_VPU_ALIGN16384(_x) (((_x)+0x3fff)&~0x3fff)
245 
246 #if 1 // QUADRA_SEI_FMT
247 #pragma pack(1)
248 typedef struct _ni_sei_header {
249  uint8_t status;
250  uint16_t size;
251  uint8_t type;
252 } ni_sei_header_t;
253 #pragma pack()
254 #else // QUADRA_SEI_FMT
255 typedef struct _ni_sei_user_data_entry
256 {
257  uint32_t offset;
258  uint32_t size;
259 } ni_sei_user_data_entry_t;
260 #endif // QUADRA_SEI_FMT
261 
262 typedef enum
263 {
264  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_RESERVED_0 = 0,
265  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_RESERVED_1 = 1,
266  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_VUI = 2,
267  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_RESERVED_3 = 3,
268  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_PIC_TIMING = 4,
269  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_ITU_T_T35_PRE = 5, /* SEI Prefix: user_data_registered_itu_t_t35 */
270  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_UNREGISTERED_PRE = 6, /* SEI Prefix: user_data_unregistered */
271  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_ITU_T_T35_SUF = 7, /* SEI Suffix: user_data_registered_itu_t_t35 */
272  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_UNREGISTERED_SUF = 8, /* SEI Suffix: user_data_unregistered */
273  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_RESERVED_9 = 9, /* SEI RESERVED */
274  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_MASTERING_COLOR_VOL = 10, /* SEI Prefix: mastering_display_color_volume */
275  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_CHROMA_RESAMPLING_FILTER_HINT = 11, /* SEI Prefix: chroma_resampling_filter_hint */
276  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_KNEE_FUNCTION_INFO = 12, /* SEI Prefix: knee_function_info */
277  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_TONE_MAPPING_INFO = 13, /* SEI Prefix: tone_mapping_info */
278  NI_H265_USER_DATA_FLAG_FILM_GRAIN_CHARACTERISTICS_INFO = 14, /* SEI Prefix: film_grain_characteristics_info */
279  NI_H265_USER_DATA_FLAG_CONTENT_LIGHT_LEVEL_INFO = 15, /* SEI Prefix: content_light_level_info */
280  NI_H265_USER_DATA_FLAG_COLOUR_REMAPPING_INFO = 16, /* SEI Prefix: content_light_level_info */
281  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_ITU_T_T35_PRE_1 = 28, /* SEI Prefix: additional user_data_registered_itu_t_t35 */
282  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_ITU_T_T35_PRE_2 = 29, /* SEI Prefix: additional user_data_registered_itu_t_t35 */
283  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_ITU_T_T35_SUF_1 = 30, /* SEI Suffix: additional user_data_registered_itu_t_t35 */
284  NI_H265_USERDATA_FLAG_ITU_T_T35_SUF_2 = 31, /* SEI Suffix: additional user_data_registered_itu_t_t35 */
285 } ni_h265_sei_user_data_type_t;
286 
287 typedef enum
288 {
289  PIC_TYPE_I = 0, /*!*< I picture */
290  PIC_TYPE_P = 1, /*!*< P picture */
291  PIC_TYPE_B = 2, /*!*< B picture (except VC1) */
292 
293  PIC_TYPE_CRA = 4,
294  PIC_TYPE_IDR = 3, /*!*< Encoder IDR pic type */
295  DECODER_PIC_TYPE_IDR = 5, /*!*< Decoder-returned IDR pic type */
296  PIC_TYPE_NIDR = 5, /*!*< H.264/H.265 IDR picture */
297  PIC_TYPE_MAX /*!*< No Meaning */
298 } ni_pic_type_t;
299 
300 #if 1 // QUADRA_SEI_FMT
301 // user data unreg and custom SEIs have variable length;
302 // non-custom SEIs will be dropped if buffer overflow;
303 // custom SEIs passthru is via SW and host memory constrained
304 #define NI_ENC_MAX_SEI_BUF_SIZE NI_VPU_ALIGN64(1024) // sync with encoder
305 
306 // PIC_TIMING and BUFFERING_PERIOD apply to encoder only, not needed from decoder
307 // For now, only the following will be returned from decoder:
308 // - T35 has 3 possible data types: CLOSE_CAPTION, HDR10PLUS, AFD
309 // - MASTERING_DISPLAY_COLOUR
310 // - CONTENT_LIGHT_LEVEL
311 // - USER_DATA_UNREGISTERED
312 // - CUSTOM_SEI
313 // Note: USER_DATA_UNREGISTERED may have arbitrary size but SEI buffer
314 // size is limited. The SEI buffer on decoder has the following format:
315 // [byte0: #entries][entry1]..[entryN]
316 // up to (1 + sizeof(ni_sei_header_t) + NI_MAX_SEI_DATA) bytes maximum;
317 // where [entryX] := [ni_sei_header][payload]
318 // [payload] of ni_sei_header.size: present only if ni_sei_header.status == 1
319 // X in [1..N] with N <= #entries
320 // N == #entries only if NI_MAX_SEI_DATA is large enough to store all #entries
321 // ex:
322 // entryX header fits in the buffer during SEI extration, but payload can't fit in;
323 // so only entryX header is stored but payload is drop with status set 0.
324 // entryX header can't fit in the buffer (SEI buffer full); so extryX is not stored
325 // in the SEI buffer (neither will any further SEIs)
326 //
327 // To maintain alignment, current implementation retrieves SEI data buffer from
328 // entry 1's payload onwards (skipping byte0, and entry 1's header),
329 // while #entries (same value as SEI buffer byte0) and entry 1's header are notified
330 // separately via metadata.
331 #define NI_MAX_SEI_DATA (NI_ENC_MAX_SEI_BUF_SIZE) // sync with decoder_manager
332 
333 #else // QUADRA_SEI_FMT
334 #define NI_MAX_SEI_ENTRIES 32
335 // 32 user_data_entry_t records + various SEI messages sizes
336 #define NI_MAX_SEI_DATA \
337  NI_MAX_SEI_ENTRIES * sizeof(ni_sei_user_data_entry_t) + \
338  NI_MAX_T35_CLOSE_CAPTION_SIZE + \
339  NI_MASTERING_DISPLAY_COLOUR_VOLUME_SIZE + \
340  NI_CONTENT_LIGHT_LEVEL_INFO_SIZE + NI_MAX_T35_HDR10PLUS_SIZE + \
341  NI_MAX_T35_AFD_SIZE
342 #endif // QUADRA_SEI_FMT
343 
344 #define NI_DEC_MAX_CC_BUF_SIZE 93 // max 31 CC entries of 3 bytes each
345 
346 #define NI_CC_SEI_BYTE0 0xB5 // itu_t_t35_country_code =181 (North America)
347 #define NI_CC_SEI_BYTE1 0x00
348 #define NI_CC_SEI_BYTE2 0x31 // itu_t_t35_provider_code = 49
349 #define NI_CC_SEI_BYTE3 0x47 // ATSC_user_identifier = "GA94"
350 #define NI_CC_SEI_BYTE4 0x41
351 #define NI_CC_SEI_BYTE5 0x39
352 #define NI_CC_SEI_BYTE6 0x34
353 
354 #define NI_HDR10P_SEI_BYTE0 0xB5 // itu_t_t35_country_code =181 (North America
355 #define NI_HDR10P_SEI_BYTE1 0x00
356 #define NI_HDR10P_SEI_BYTE2 0x3c // itu_t_t35_provider_code = 0x003c
357 #define NI_HDR10P_SEI_BYTE3 0x00
358 #define NI_HDR10P_SEI_BYTE4 0x01 // u16 itu_t_t35_provider_oriented_code = 0x0001
359 #define NI_HDR10P_SEI_BYTE5 0x04 // u8 application_identifier = 0x04
360 #define NI_HDR10P_SEI_BYTE6 0x00 // u8 application version = 0x00
361 
362 #define NI_CC_SEI_HDR_HEVC_LEN 18
363 #define NI_HDR10P_SEI_HDR_HEVC_LEN 9
364 #define NI_HDR10P_SEI_HDR_H264_LEN 8
365 #define NI_CC_SEI_HDR_H264_LEN 17
366 #define NI_CC_SEI_TRAILER_LEN 2
367 #define NI_RBSP_TRAILING_BITS_LEN 1
368 
369 #define NI_MAX_NUM_AUX_DATA_PER_FRAME 16
370 
372 #define NI_BITRATE_RECONFIG_FILE_MAX_LINES 50000
373 #define NI_BITRATE_RECONFIG_FILE_MAX_ENTRIES_PER_LINE 10
376 
377 // frame auxiliary data; mostly used for SEI data associated with frame
378 typedef enum _ni_frame_aux_data_type
379 {
380  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_NONE = 0,
381 
382  // ATSC A53 Part 4 Closed Captions
383  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_A53_CC,
384 
385  // HDR10 mastering display metadata associated with a video frame
386  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_MASTERING_DISPLAY_METADATA,
387 
388  // HDR10 content light level (based on CTA-861.3). This payload contains
389  // data in the form of ni_content_light_level_t struct.
390  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_CONTENT_LIGHT_LEVEL,
391 
392  // HDR10+ dynamic metadata associated with a video frame. The payload is
393  // a ni_dynamic_hdr_plus_t struct that contains information for color volume
394  // transform - application 4 of SMPTE 2094-40:2016 standard.
395  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_HDR_PLUS,
396 
397  // Regions of Interest, the payload is an array of ni_region_of_interest_t,
398  // the number of array element is implied by:
399  // ni_frame_aux_data.size / sizeof(ni_region_of_interest_t)
400  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_REGIONS_OF_INTEREST,
401 
402  // NETINT: user data unregistered SEI data, which takes SEI payload type
403  // USER_DATA_UNREGISTERED.
404  // There will be no byte reordering.
405  // Usually this payload would be: 16B UUID + other payload Bytes.
406  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_UDU_SEI,
407 
408  // NETINT: custom SEI data, which takes SEI payload custom types.
409  // There will be no byte reordering.
410  // Usually this payload would be: 1B Custom SEI type + 16B UUID + other
411  // payload Bytes.
412  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_CUSTOM_SEI,
413 
414  // NETINT: custom bitrate adjustment, which takes int32_t type data as
415  // payload that indicates the new target bitrate value.
416  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_BITRATE,
417 
418  // NETINT: custom VUI adjustment, which is a struct of
419  // ni_long_term_ref_t that specifies a frame's support of long term
420  // reference frame.
421  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_VUI,
422 
423  // NETINT: long term reference frame support, which is a struct of
424  // ni_long_term_ref_t that specifies a frame's support of long term
425  // reference frame.
426  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_LONG_TERM_REF,
427 
428  // NETINT: long term reference interval adjustment, which takes int32_t
429  // type data as payload that indicates the new long term reference interval
430  // value.
431  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_LTR_INTERVAL,
432 
433  // NETINT: frame reference invalidation, which takes int32_t type data
434  // as payload that indicates the frame number after which all references
435  // shall be invalidated.
436  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_INVALID_REF_FRAME,
437 
438  // NETINT: custom framerate adjustment, which takes int32_t type data as
439  // payload that indicates the new target framerate numerator and denominator values.
440  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_FRAMERATE,
441 
442  // NETINT: custom maxFrameSize adjustment, which takes int32_t type data as
443  // payload that indicates the new maxFrameSize value
444  NI_FRAME_AUX_DATA_MAX_FRAME_SIZE,
445 } ni_aux_data_type_t;
446 
447 // rational number (pair of numerator and denominator)
448 typedef struct _ni_rational
449 {
450  int num; // numerator
451  int den; // denominator
452 } ni_rational_t;
453 
454 // create an ni_rational_t
455 static inline ni_rational_t ni_make_q(int num, int den)
456 {
457  ni_rational_t ret = {num, den};
458  return ret;
459 }
460 
461 // convert an ni_rational_t to a double
462 static inline double ni_q2d(ni_rational_t a)
463 {
464  return a.num / (double)a.den;
465 }
466 
467 // struct to hold auxiliary data for ni_frame_t
468 typedef struct _ni_aux_data
469 {
470  ni_aux_data_type_t type;
471  uint8_t *data;
472  int size;
473 } ni_aux_data_t;
474 
475 // struct describing a Region Of Interest (ROI)
476 typedef struct _ni_region_of_interest
477 {
478  // self size: must be set to: sizeof(ni_region_of_interest_t)
479  uint32_t self_size;
480 
481  // ROI rectangle: pixels from the frame's top edge to the top and bottom
482  // edges of the rectangle, from the frame's left edge to the left and right
483  // edges of the rectangle.
484  int top;
485  int bottom;
486  int left;
487  int right;
488 
489  // quantisation offset: [-1, +1], 0 means no quality change; < 0 value asks
490  // for better quality (less quantisation), > 0 value asks for worse quality
491  // (greater quantisation).
492  ni_rational_t qoffset;
493 } ni_region_of_interest_t;
494 
495 // struct describing VUI HRD support.
496 typedef struct _ni_vui_hrd
497 {
498  // Indicates the presence of color info such as primaries, trc etc.
499  int32_t colorDescPresent;
500 
501  // Indicates the chromaticity of RGB and white components of the
502  // displayed image (See Table E.3 of H.265 spec)
503  int32_t colorPrimaries;
504 
505  // The opto-electronic transfer characteristic of the source picture
506  // (See Table E.4 of H.265 spec)
507  int32_t colorTrc;
508 
509  // Method to represent brightness, luminance or luma and colour (e.g. RGB)
510  int32_t colorSpace;
511 
512  // Luma sample aspect ratio width. With aspectRatioHeight, translates
513  // into specific display ratios such as 16:9, 4:3, etc.
514  int32_t aspectRatioWidth;
515 
516  // Luma sample aspect ratio height
517  int32_t aspectRatioHeight;
518 
519  // Input video signal sample range [0,1].
520  // 0 = Y range in [16..235] Cb,Cr in [16..240]. 1 = Y,Cb,Cr in [0..255]
521  int32_t videoFullRange;
522 } ni_vui_hrd_t;
523 
524 // struct describing long term reference frame support.
525 typedef struct _ni_long_term_ref
526 {
527  // A flag for the current picture to be used as a long term reference
528  // picture later at other pictures' encoding
529  uint8_t use_cur_src_as_long_term_pic;
530 
531  // A flag to use a long term reference picture in DPB when encoding the
532  // current picture
533  uint8_t use_long_term_ref;
534 } ni_long_term_ref_t;
535 
536 // struct describing framerate.
537 typedef struct _ni_framerate
538 {
539  // framerate numerator
540  int32_t framerate_num;
541 
542  // framerate denominator
543  int32_t framerate_denom;
544 } ni_framerate_t;
545 
546 typedef struct _ni_dec_win
547 {
548  int16_t left;
549  int16_t right;
550  int16_t top;
551  int16_t bottom;
552 } ni_dec_win_t;
553 
554 typedef struct _ni_extended_dec_metadata
555 {
556  uint32_t num_units_in_tick;
557  uint32_t time_scale;
558  // 52 bytes reserved for receiving more header info
559  uint32_t rsvd0;
560  uint64_t rsvd1;
561  uint64_t rsvd2;
562  uint64_t rsvd3;
563  uint64_t rsvd4;
564  uint64_t rsvd5;
565  uint64_t rsvd6;
566 } ni_extended_dec_metadata_t;
567 
568 /*!*
569 * \brief decoded payload format of H.265 VUI
570 *
571 */
572 typedef struct _ni_dec_h265_vui_param
573 {
574  uint8_t aspect_ratio_info_present_flag;
575  uint8_t aspect_ratio_idc;
576  uint8_t overscan_info_present_flag;
577  uint8_t overscan_appropriate_flag;
578 
579  uint8_t video_signal_type_present_flag;
580  int8_t video_format;
581 
582  uint8_t video_full_range_flag;
583  uint8_t colour_description_present_flag;
584 
585  uint16_t sar_width;
586  uint16_t sar_height;
587 
588  uint8_t colour_primaries;
589  uint8_t transfer_characteristics;
590  uint8_t matrix_coefficients;
591 
592  uint8_t chroma_loc_info_present_flag;
593  int8_t chroma_sample_loc_type_top_field;
594  int8_t chroma_sample_loc_type_bottom_field;
595 
596  uint8_t neutral_chroma_indication_flag;
597 
598  uint8_t field_seq_flag;
599 
600  uint8_t frame_field_info_present_flag;
601  uint8_t default_display_window_flag;
602  uint8_t vui_timing_info_present_flag;
603  uint8_t vui_poc_proportional_to_timing_flag;
604 
605  uint32_t vui_num_units_in_tick;
606  uint32_t vui_time_scale;
607 
608  uint8_t vui_hrd_parameters_present_flag;
609  uint8_t bitstream_restriction_flag;
610 
611  uint8_t tiles_fixed_structure_flag;
612  uint8_t motion_vectors_over_pic_boundaries_flag;
613  uint8_t restricted_ref_pic_lists_flag;
614  int8_t min_spatial_segmentation_idc;
615  int8_t max_bytes_per_pic_denom;
616  int8_t max_bits_per_mincu_denom;
617 
618  int16_t vui_num_ticks_poc_diff_one_minus1;
619  int8_t log2_max_mv_length_horizontal;
620  int8_t log2_max_mv_length_vertical;
621 
622  ni_dec_win_t def_disp_win;
623 
624 } ni_dec_h265_vui_param_t;
625 
626 /*!*
627 * \brief decoded payload format of H.264 VUI
628 *
629 */
630 typedef struct _ni_dec_h264_vui_param
631 {
632  uint8_t aspect_ratio_info_present_flag;
633  uint8_t aspect_ratio_idc;
634  uint8_t overscan_info_present_flag;
635  uint8_t overscan_appropriate_flag;
636 
637  uint8_t video_signal_type_present_flag;
638  int8_t video_format;
639  uint8_t video_full_range_flag;
640  uint8_t colour_description_present_flag;
641 
642  uint16_t sar_width;
643  uint16_t sar_height;
644 
645  uint8_t colour_primaries;
646  uint8_t transfer_characteristics;
647  uint8_t matrix_coefficients;
648  uint8_t chroma_loc_info_present_flag;
649 
650  int8_t chroma_sample_loc_type_top_field;
651  int8_t chroma_sample_loc_type_bottom_field;
652 
653  uint8_t vui_timing_info_present_flag;
654  uint8_t fixed_frame_rate_flag;
655 
656  uint32_t vui_num_units_in_tick;
657  uint32_t vui_time_scale;
658 
659  uint8_t nal_hrd_parameters_present_flag;
660  uint8_t vcl_hrd_parameters_present_flag;
661  uint8_t low_delay_hrd_flag;
662  uint8_t pic_struct_present_flag;
663 
664  uint8_t bitstream_restriction_flag;
665  uint8_t motion_vectors_over_pic_boundaries_flag;
666  int8_t max_bytes_per_pic_denom;
667  int8_t max_bits_per_mincu_denom;
668 
669  int8_t log2_max_mv_length_horizontal;
670  int8_t log2_max_mv_length_vertical;

672  int8_t max_dec_frame_buffering;
673 } ni_dec_h264_vui_param_t;
674 
675 /*!*
676 * \brief encoder HEVC ROI custom map (1 CTU = 64bits)
677 */
678 typedef union _ni_enc_hevc_roi_custom_map
679 {
680  struct
681  {
682  uint32_t ctu_force_mode : 2; //[ 1: 0]
683  uint32_t ctu_coeff_drop : 1; //[ 2]
684  uint32_t reserved : 5; //[ 7: 3]
685  uint32_t sub_ctu_qp_0 : 6; //[13: 8]
686  uint32_t sub_ctu_qp_1 : 6; //[19:14]
687  uint32_t sub_ctu_qp_2 : 6; //[25:20]
688  uint32_t sub_ctu_qp_3 : 6; //[31:26]
689 
690  uint32_t lambda_sad_0 : 8; //[39:32]
691  uint32_t lambda_sad_1 : 8; //[47:40]
692  uint32_t lambda_sad_2 : 8; //[55:48]
693  uint32_t lambda_sad_3 : 8; //[63:56]
694  } field;
695 } ni_enc_hevc_roi_custom_map_t;
696 
697 /*!*
698 * \brief encoder AVC ROI custom map (1 MB = 8bits)
699 */
700 typedef union _ni_enc_avc_roi_custom_map
701 {
702  struct
703  {
704  uint8_t mb_force_mode : 2; // [ 1: 0]
705  uint8_t mb_qp : 6; // [ 7: 2]
706  } field;
707 } ni_enc_avc_roi_custom_map_t;
708 
709 /*!*
710 * \brief encoder AVC ROI custom map (1 MB = 8bits)
711 */
712 // QP/CU Control Information Format 1
713 typedef union _ni_enc_quad_roi_custom_map
714 {
715  struct
716  {
717  uint8_t roiAbsQp_flag : 1; // [ 0] (0: QP_delta, 1: abs_QP)
718  uint8_t
719  qp_info : 6; // [ 6: 1] (QP_delta: -32 <= qp_info <= 31, QP_info =- QP_delta, abs_QP: 0 <= Qp_info <= 51, Qp_info = abs_QP)
720  uint8_t
721  ipcm_flag : 1; // [ 7] (0: do not force IPCM mode, 1: force IPCM mode)
722  } field;
723 } ni_enc_quad_roi_custom_map;
724 // QP/CU Control Information Format 2
725 /*
726 typedef union _ni_enc_quad_roi_custom_map
727 {
728  struct
729  {
730  uint8_t qp_info : 6; // [ 5: 0] (QP_delta: -32 <= qp_info <= 31, QP_info =- QP_delta, abs_QP: 0 <= Qp_info <= 51, Qp_info = abs_QP)
731  uint8_t roiAbsQp_flag : 1; // [ 6] (0: QP_delta, 1: abs_QP)
732  uint8_t skip_flag : 1; // [ 7] (0: do not force skip mode, 1: force skip)
733  } field;
734 } ni_enc_quad_roi_custom_map;
735 */
736 /*!*
737 * \brief This is an enumeration for supported codec formats.
738 */

740 {
741  NI_CODEC_FORMAT_H264 = 0,
742  NI_CODEC_FORMAT_H265 = 1,
743  NI_CODEC_FORMAT_VP9 = 2,
744  NI_CODEC_FORMAT_JPEG = 3,
745  NI_CODEC_FORMAT_AV1 = 4
746 } ni_codec_format_t;
747

753  NI_PIXEL_PLANAR_MAX
754 } ni_pixel_planar_format;

764 /*!*
765 * \brief This is an enumeration for hw actions
766 */
767 typedef enum ni_codec_hw_actions
768 {
769  NI_CODEC_HW_NONE = 0,
770  NI_CODEC_HW_ENABLE = (1 << 0),
771  NI_CODEC_HW_DOWNLOAD = (1 << 1),
772  NI_CODEC_HW_UPLOAD = (1 << 2),
773  NI_CODEC_HW_RSVD = (1 << 3),
774  NI_CODEC_HW_PAYLOAD_OFFSET = 4
775 } ni_codec_hw_actions_t;
776 
777 /*!*
778 * \brief This is an enumeration for encoder parameter change.
779 */
780 typedef enum _ni_param_change_flags
781 {
782  // COMMON parameters which can be changed frame by frame.
783  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_PPS = (1 << 0),
784  //NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_INTRA_PARAM = (1 << 1), // not required by customer
785  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_RC_TARGET_RATE = (1 << 8),
786  //NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_RC = (1 << 9), // not required by customer
787  //NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_RC_MIN_MAX_QP = (1 << 10), // not required by customer
788  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_RC_BIT_RATIO_LAYER = (1 << 11),
789  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_INDEPEND_SLICE = (1 << 16),
790  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_DEPEND_SLICE = (1 << 17),
791  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_RDO = (1 << 18),
792  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_NR = (1 << 19),
793  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_BG = (1 << 20),
794  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_CUSTOM_MD = (1 << 21),
795  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_CUSTOM_LAMBDA = (1 << 22),
796  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_RC2 = (1 << 23),
797  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_VUI_HRD_PARAM = (1 << 24),
798  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_INVALID_REF_FRAME = (1 << 25),
799  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_LTR_INTERVAL = (1 << 26),
800  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_RC_FRAMERATE = (1 << 27),
801  NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_MAX_FRAME_SIZE = (1 << 28),
802 
803 } ni_param_change_flags_t;
804 
808 typedef struct _ni_encoder_change_params_t
809 {
810  uint32_t enable_option;
811 
812  // NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_RC_TARGET_RATE
813  int32_t bitRate;
816  // NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_RC
817 // (rcEnable, cuLevelRc, bitAllocMode, RoiEnable, RcInitQp can't be changed while encoding)
818  int32_t hvsQPEnable;
819  int32_t hvsQpScale;
820  int32_t vbvBufferSize;
821  int32_t mbLevelRcEnable;
823  // NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_RC_MIN_MAX_QP
824  int32_t minQpI;
825  int32_t maxQpI;
827  int32_t maxDeltaQp;
828 #ifdef QUADRA
829  int32_t minQpPB;
830  int32_t maxQpPB;
831 #else
832  int32_t minQpP;
833  int32_t minQpB;
834  int32_t maxQpP;
835  int32_t maxQpB;
836 #endif
837 
838  // NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_INTRA_PARAM
839  int32_t intraQP;
840  int32_t intraPeriod;
841  int32_t repeatHeaders;
843 #ifdef QUADRA
844  // NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_VUI_HRD_PARAM
845  uint8_t colorDescPresent;
846  uint8_t colorPrimaries;
847  uint8_t colorTrc;
848  uint8_t colorSpace;
849  uint16_t aspectRatioWidth;
850  uint16_t aspectRatioHeight;
851  uint8_t videoFullRange;
853  // RESERVED FOR FUTURE USE
854  uint8_t reserved[13];
855 
856  // NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_MAX_FRAME_SIZE
857  uint16_t maxFrameSize; // maxFrameSize reconfig (in unit of 2000 bytes)
858 
859  // NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_INVALID_REF_FRAME
860  int32_t invalidFrameNum;
861 
862  // NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_LTR_INTERVAL
863  int32_t ltrInterval;
864 
865  // NI_SET_CHANGE_PARAM_RC_FRAMERATE
866  int32_t frameRateNum;
867  int32_t frameRateDenom;
868 #else
869  int32_t reserved[8];
870 #endif
871 } ni_encoder_change_params_t;
872 
873 /*!*
874 * \brief decoded payload format of HDR SEI mastering display colour volume
875 *

952 } ni_hw_capability_t;

954 /*!*
955 * \brief device capability type
956 */

958 {

962  uint8_t xcoder_cnt[NI_DEVICE_TYPE_XCODER_MAX];
963  ni_hw_capability_t xcoder_devices[NI_MAX_DEVICES_PER_HW_INSTANCE];
964 
965  uint8_t serial_number[20];
966  uint8_t model_number[40];
967 
968  uint8_t fw_rev[8]; // space right filled ASCII array, not a string
969  uint8_t fw_branch_name[256];
970  uint8_t fw_commit_time[26];
971  uint8_t fw_commit_hash[41];
972  uint8_t fw_build_time[26];
973  uint8_t fw_build_id[256];
974 } ni_device_capability_t;
975 
976 /*!*
977 * \brief Session running state type.
978 */

980 {
981  SESSION_RUN_STATE_NORMAL = 0,
982  SESSION_RUN_STATE_SEQ_CHANGE_DRAINING = 1,
983  SESSION_RUN_STATE_SEQ_CHANGE_OPENING = 2,
984  SESSION_RUN_STATE_RESETTING = 3,
985 } ni_session_run_state_t;
986 
987 typedef struct _ni_context_query
988 {
989  uint32_t context_id : 8; //07:00 SW Instance ID (0 to Max number of instances)
990  uint32_t context_status : 8; //15:08 Instance Status (0-Idle, 1-Active)
991  uint32_t
992  codec_format : 8; //23:16 Codec Format (0-H264, 1-H265, 2-VP9, 3-JPEG, 4-AV1)
993  uint32_t video_width : 16; //39:24 Video Width (0 to Max Width)
994  uint32_t video_height : 16; //55:40 Video Height (0 to Max Height)
995  uint32_t fps : 8; //63:56 FPS (0 to 255)
996  uint32_t reserved : 8; //Alignment
997 } ni_context_query_t;
998 
999 typedef struct _ni_load_query
1000 {
1001  uint32_t current_load;
1002  uint32_t fw_model_load;
1003  uint32_t total_contexts;
1004  uint32_t fw_video_mem_usage;
1005  uint32_t fw_share_mem_usage;
1006  uint32_t fw_p2p_mem_usage;
1007  uint32_t active_hwuploaders;
1008  ni_context_query_t context_status[NI_MAX_CONTEXTS_PER_HW_INSTANCE];
1009 } ni_load_query_t;
1010 
1011 typedef struct _ni_thread_arg_struct_t
1012 {
1013  int hw_id; // Codec ID
1014  uint32_t session_id; // session id
1015  uint64_t session_timestamp; // Session Start Timestamp
1016  bool close_thread; // a flag that the keep alive thread is closed or need to be closed
1017  uint32_t device_type; // Device Type, Either NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER
1018  ni_device_handle_t device_handle; // block device handler
1019  ni_event_handle_t thread_event_handle; // only for Windows asynchronous read and write
1020  void *p_buffer; // only be used when regular-io.
1021  uint32_t keep_alive_timeout; // keep alive timeout setting
1022 } ni_thread_arg_struct_t;
1023 
1024 typedef struct _ni_buf_t
1025 {
1026  void* buf;
1027  struct _ni_buf_pool_t* pool;
1028  struct _ni_buf_t *p_prev;
1029  struct _ni_buf_t *p_next;
1030  struct _ni_buf_t *p_previous_buffer;
1031  struct _ni_buf_t *p_next_buffer;
1032 } ni_buf_t;
1033 
1034 typedef struct _ni_buf_pool_t
1035 {
1036  ni_pthread_mutex_t mutex;
1037  uint32_t number_of_buffers;
1038  uint32_t buf_size;
1039  ni_buf_t *p_free_head;
1040  ni_buf_t *p_free_tail;
1041  ni_buf_t *p_used_head;
1042  ni_buf_t *p_used_tail;
1043 } ni_buf_pool_t;
1044 
1045 typedef struct _ni_queue_node_t
1046 {
1047  uint64_t timestamp;
1048  uint64_t frame_info;
1049  time_t checkout_timestamp;
1050  struct _ni_queue_node_t *p_prev;
1051  struct _ni_queue_node_t *p_next;
1052  struct _ni_queue_node_t *p_previous_buffer;
1053  struct _ni_queue_node_t *p_next_buffer;
1054 } ni_queue_node_t;
1055 
1056 typedef struct _ni_queue_buffer_pool_t
1057 {
1058  uint32_t number_of_buffers; // total number of buffers
1059  ni_queue_node_t *p_free_head;
1060  ni_queue_node_t *p_free_tail;
1061  ni_queue_node_t *p_used_head;
1062  ni_queue_node_t *p_used_tail;
1063 } ni_queue_buffer_pool_t;
1064 
1065 typedef struct _ni_queue_t
1066 {
1067  char name[32];
1068  uint32_t count;
1069  ni_queue_node_t *p_first;
1070  ni_queue_node_t *p_last;
1071 } ni_queue_t;
1072 
1073 typedef struct _ni_timestamp_table_t
1074 {
1075  ni_queue_t list;
1076 } ni_timestamp_table_t;
1077 
1078 typedef struct _ni_session_context
1079 {
1081  /* frame_time_q is pointer to ni_lat_meas_q_t but reserved as void pointer
1082  here as ni_lat_meas_q_t is part of private API */
1083  void *frame_time_q;
1084  uint64_t prev_read_frame_time;
1085 
1087  uint8_t itu_t_t35_cc_sei_hdr_hevc[NI_CC_SEI_HDR_HEVC_LEN];
1088  uint8_t itu_t_t35_cc_sei_hdr_h264[NI_CC_SEI_HDR_H264_LEN];

1090  uint8_t itu_t_t35_hdr10p_sei_hdr_h264[NI_HDR10P_SEI_HDR_H264_LEN];

1215  uint32_t active_video_height;

1217  uint32_t actual_video_width;

1219  uint32_t biggest_bitstream_buffer_allocated;

1222  ni_queue_buffer_pool_t *buffer_pool;

1226  int ori_width, ori_height, ori_bit_depth_factor, ori_pix_fmt;
1227

1229  ni_pthread_mutex_t mutex;
1230 
1231  // Xcoder running state
1232  uint32_t xcoder_state;
1233 
1234  // only be used when regular-io
1235  void *p_all_zero_buf; //This is for sos, eos, flush and keep alive request
1236 
1237  // these two event handle are only for Windows asynchronous read and write now
1238  ni_event_handle_t event_handle;
1239  ni_event_handle_t thread_event_handle;

1247 
1248  // encoder reconfig parameters

1250  // decoder lowDelay mode for All I packets or IPPP packets
1251  int decoder_low_delay;
1252 
1253  // wrapper API request data, to be sent out once with the next input frame
1254  // to encoder
1255  int32_t target_bitrate; // A target bitrate to reconfig, -1 if inactive
1256  int force_idr_frame; // force IDR frame type
1257  ni_long_term_ref_t ltr_to_set; // LTR to be set
1258  int32_t ltr_interval; // LTR interval to set
1259  int32_t ltr_frame_ref_invalid; // frame after which all ref to be invalid
1260  ni_framerate_t framerate; // framerate to reconfig, 0 if inactive
1261  ni_vui_hrd_t vui; // vui to reconfig
1262 
1263  // path of decoder input pkt saving folder
1264  char stream_dir_name[256];
1265  int hw_action;
1266  uint32_t scaler_operation;
1267 
1268  // some parameters for decoder session
1269  // int hw_frame_extra_buffer; e.g. 3
1270  int enable_user_data_sei_passthru;
1271  int burst_control;
1272  int pixel_format;
1273  int32_t isP2P;
1274  int netint_fd;
1275  unsigned short domain;
1276  unsigned short bus;
1277  unsigned short dev;
1278  unsigned short fn;
1279 
1280  // the FW API version of device that opened
1281  uint8_t fw_rev[8];
1282  uint8_t ddr_config;
1283 
1285 
1287  uint32_t prev_fps;

1295  int64_t last_dts_interval;
1296  int pic_reorder_delay;
1297 
1298  // flags_array to save packet flags
1299  int flags_array[NI_FIFO_SZ];
1300 
1301  // for decoder: store currently returned decoded frame's pkt offset
1302  uint64_t frame_pkt_offset;
1303  uint32_t force_idr_intra_offset;
1304 
1305  ni_session_statistic_t session_statistic;
1306 
1307  uint32_t count_frame_num_in_sec; //used in the vfr mode, indicate the frame count in seconds
1308  uint32_t passed_time_in_timebase_unit; //used in the vfr mode, indicate how long it has passed
1309 
1310  int32_t max_frame_size; // maxFrameSize (in bytes) to reconfig, 0 if inactive
1311 
1312  // block device name requested by caller to open: when specified this block
1313  // device has priority over hw_id which is device specified by index.
1314  char blk_dev_name[NI_MAX_DEVICE_NAME_LEN];
1315 
1316  // decoder low delay send/recv sync; async_mode = 0 by default, i.e.
1317  // codec send-to/recv-from FW is in synchrounous mode by default.
1318  int async_mode;
1319  int low_delay_sync_flag;
1320  ni_pthread_mutex_t low_delay_sync_mutex;
1321  ni_pthread_cond_t low_delay_sync_cond;
1322 
1323  // muxtex default from source session
1324  // required pointer to external if used by hwdl
1325  ni_pthread_mutex_t* pext_mutex;
1326 } ni_session_context_t;

1338 /*!*
1339 * \brief This is an enumeration for encoder reconfiguration test settings
1340 */
1341 typedef enum _ni_reconfig
1342 {
1343  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_OFF = 0,
1344  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_BR = 1,
1345  //XCODER_TEST_RECONF_INTRAPRD = 2, // not required by customer
1346  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_VUI_HRD = 3,
1347  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_LONG_TERM_REF = 4,
1348 //XCODER_TEST_RECONF_RC = 5, // // not required by customer
1349 //XCODER_TEST_RECONF_RC_MIN_MAX_QP = 6, // // not required by customer
1350 #ifdef QUADRA
1351  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_LTR_INTERVAL = 7,
1352  XCODER_TEST_INVALID_REF_FRAME = 8,
1353  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_FRAMERATE = 9,
1354  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_MAX_FRAME_SIZE = 10,
1355  XCODER_TEST_FORCE_IDR_FRAME = 100, // force IDR through libxcoder API
1356  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_BR_API = 101, // reconfig BR through libxcoder API
1357  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_VUI_HRD_API = 103, // reconfig VUI through libxcoder API
1358  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_LTR_API = 104, // reconfig LTR through libxcoder API
1359  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_LTR_INTERVAL_API = 107, // reconf LTR interval thru API
1360  XCODER_TEST_INVALID_REF_FRAME_API = 108, // invalidate ref frame thru API
1361  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_FRAMERATE_API =
1362  109, // reconfig framerate through libxcoder API
1363  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_MAX_FRAME_SIZE_API =
1364  110, // reconfig maxFrameSize through libxcoder API
1365  XCODER_TEST_RECONF_END = 111,
1366 #endif
1367 } ni_reconfig_t;
1368 
1369 typedef enum _ni_ai_buffer_format_e
1370 {
1371  /* A float type of buffer data */
1372  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_FP32 = 0,
1373  /* A half float type of buffer data */
1374  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_FP16 = 1,
1375  /* A 8 bit unsigned integer type of buffer data */
1376  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_UINT8 = 2,
1377  /* A 8 bit signed integer type of buffer data */
1378  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_INT8 = 3,
1379  /* A 16 bit unsigned integer type of buffer data */
1380  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_UINT16 = 4,
1381  /* A 16 signed integer type of buffer data */
1382  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_INT16 = 5,
1383  /* A char type of data */
1384  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_CHAR = 6,
1385  /* A bfloat 16 type of data */
1386  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_BFP16 = 7,
1387  /* A 32 bit integer type of data */
1388  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_INT32 = 8,
1389  /* A 32 bit unsigned signed integer type of buffer */
1390  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_UINT32 = 9,
1391  /* A 64 bit signed integer type of data */
1392  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_INT64 = 10,
1393  /* A 64 bit unsigned integer type of data */
1394  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_UINT64 = 11,
1395  /* A 64 bit float type of buffer data */
1396  NI_AI_BUFFER_FORMAT_FP64 = 12,
1397 } ni_ai_buffer_format_e;
1398 
1399 typedef enum _ni_ai_buffer_quantize_format_e
1400 {
1401  /* Not quantized format */
1402  NI_AI_BUFFER_QUANTIZE_NONE = 0,
1403  /* A quantization data type which specifies the fixed point position for whole tensor. */
1404  NI_AI_BUFFER_QUANTIZE_DYNAMIC_FIXED_POINT = 1,
1405  /* A quantization data type which has scale value and zero point to match with TF and
1406  Android NN API for whole tensor. */
1407  NI_AI_BUFFER_QUANTIZE_TF_ASYMM = 2,
1408  /* A max vaule support quantize format */
1409  NI_AI_BUFFER_QUANTIZE_MAX,
1410 } ni_ai_buffer_quantize_format_e;
1411 
1412 #define NI_MAX_NETWORK_INPUT_NUM 4
1413 #define NI_MAX_NETWORK_OUTPUT_NUM 4
1414 
1415 typedef struct _ni_network_layer_params_t
1416 {
1417  uint32_t num_of_dims; /* The number of dimensions specified in *sizes */
1418  uint32_t sizes[6]; /* The pointer to an array of dimension */
1419  int32_t
1420  data_format; /* Data format for the tensor, see ni_ai_buffer_format_e */
1421  int32_t
1422  quant_format; /* Quantized format see ni_ai_buffer_quantize_format_e */
1423  union
1424  {
1425  struct
1426  {
1427  int32_t
1428  fixed_point_pos; /* Specifies the fixed point position when the input element type is int16, if 0 calculations are performed in integer math */
1429  } dfp;
1430 
1431  struct
1432  {
1433  float scale; /* Scale value for the quantized value */
1434  int32_t zeroPoint; /* A 32 bit integer, in range [0, 255] */
1435  } affine;
1436  } quant_data; /* The union of quantization information */
1437  /* The type of this buffer memory. */
1438  uint32_t memory_type;
1439 } ni_network_layer_params_t;
1440 
1441 typedef struct _ni_network_layer_info
1442 {
1443  ni_network_layer_params_t in_param[NI_MAX_NETWORK_INPUT_NUM];
1444  ni_network_layer_params_t out_param[NI_MAX_NETWORK_OUTPUT_NUM];
1445 } ni_network_layer_info_t;
1446 
1447 typedef struct _ni_network_data
1448 {
1449  uint32_t input_num;
1450  uint32_t output_num;
1451  ni_network_layer_info_t linfo;
1452  struct
1453  {
1454  int32_t
1455  offset; /* point to each input layer start offset from p_frame */
1456  } inset[NI_MAX_NETWORK_INPUT_NUM];
1457  struct
1458  {
1459  int32_t
1460  offset; /* point to each output layer start offset from p_packet */
1461  } outset[NI_MAX_NETWORK_OUTPUT_NUM];
1462 } ni_network_data_t;

1585 typedef struct _ni_gop_rps
1586 {
1587  int ref_pic; /*!*< delta_poc of this short reference picture relative to the poc of current picture or index of LTR */
1588  int ref_pic_used; /*!*< whether this reference picture used by current picture */
1589 } ni_gop_rps_t;
1590 
1591 typedef struct _ni_gop_params
1592 {
1593  int poc_offset; /*!*< A POC of Nth picture in the custom GOP */
1594  int qp_offset; /*!*< QP offset of Nth picture in the custom GOP */
1595  float qp_factor; /*!*< QP factor of Nth picture in the custom GOP */
1596  int temporal_id; /*!*< A temporal ID of Nth picture in the custom GOP */
1597  int pic_type; /*!*< A picture type of Nth picture in the custom GOP */
1598  int num_ref_pics; /*!*< the number of reference pictures kept for this picture, the value should be within [0, 4] */
1599  ni_gop_rps_t rps[NI_MAX_REF_PIC];
1600 } ni_gop_params_t;

1667 {

1672  int ref_poc_L0; /*!*< A POC of reference L0 of Nth picture in the custom GOP */
1673  int ref_poc_L1; /*!*< A POC of reference L1 of Nth picture in the custom GOP */
1674  int temporal_id; /*!*< A temporal ID of Nth picture in the custom GOP */
1675 } ni_gop_params_t;

1906  int use_recommend_enc_params; /*!*< 0: Custom, 1: Slow speed and best quality, 2: Normal Speed and quality, 3: Fast Speed and Low Quality */

1908  int cu_size_mode; /*!*< bit 0: enable 8x8 CU, bit 1: enable 16x16 CU, bit 2: enable 32x32 CU */

1923  struct //Rate control parameters
1924  {
1925  int enable_rate_control; /*!*< It enable rate control */
1926  int min_qp; /*!*< A minimum QP for rate control */ //8
1927  int max_qp; /*!*< A maximum QP for rate control */ //51
1928  int intra_qp;
1929  int intra_qp_delta;
1930  int enable_pic_skip;
1931 
1932  //no JPEG
1933  int enable_cu_level_rate_control; /*!*< It enable CU level rate control */
1934  int enable_hvs_qp; /*!*< It enable CU QP adjustment for subjective quality enhancement */
1935  int hvs_qp_scale; /*!*< A QP scaling factor for CU QP adjustment when hvcQpenable = 1 */
1936  int enable_filler;
1937  int vbv_buffer_size;
1938 
1939  //deprecated
1940  int enable_hvs_qp_scale; /*!*< It enable QP scaling factor for CU QP adjustment when enable_hvs_qp = 1 */
1941  int max_delta_qp; /*!*< A maximum delta QP for rate control */ //10
1942  int trans_rate;
1943  int enable_mb_level_rc;
1944  } rc;
1945  int keep_alive_timeout; /* keep alive timeout setting */
1946  int enable_ssim;
1947  int av1_error_resilient_mode;
1948  int intra_reset_refresh;
1949 } ni_encoder_cfg_params_t;
1950 
1951 typedef struct _ni_decoder_input_params_t
1952 {
1953 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_OUT "out"
1954 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_ENABLE_OUT_1 "enableOut1"
1955 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_ENABLE_OUT_2 "enableOut2"
1956 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_FORCE_8BIT_0 "force8Bit0"
1957 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_FORCE_8BIT_1 "force8Bit1"
1958 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_FORCE_8BIT_2 "force8Bit2"
1959 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_SEMI_PLANAR_0 "semiplanar0"
1960 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_SEMI_PLANAR_1 "semiplanar1"
1961 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_SEMI_PLANAR_2 "semiplanar2"
1962 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_CROP_MODE_0 "cropMode0"
1963 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_CROP_MODE_1 "cropMode1"
1964 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_CROP_MODE_2 "cropMode2"
1965 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_CROP_PARAM_0 "crop0"
1966 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_CROP_PARAM_1 "crop1"
1967 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_CROP_PARAM_2 "crop2"
1968 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_SCALE_0 "scale0"
1969 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_SCALE_1 "scale1"

1972 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_SAVE_PKT "savePkt"
1973 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_LOW_DELAY "lowDelay"
1974 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_ENABLE_USR_DATA_SEI_PASSTHRU "enableUserDataSeiPassthru"
1975 #define NI_DEC_PARAM_ENABLE_CUSTOM_SEI_PASSTHRU "customSeiPassthru"
1976 
1977  int hwframes;
1978  int enable_out1;
1979  int enable_out2;
1980  int mcmode;
1981  int nb_save_pkt; // number of decoder input packets to be saved

1984  int crop_mode[NI_MAX_NUM_OF_DECODER_OUTPUTS];
1985  int crop_whxy[NI_MAX_NUM_OF_DECODER_OUTPUTS][4];
1986  char cr_expr[NI_MAX_NUM_OF_DECODER_OUTPUTS][4]
1987  [NI_MAX_PPU_PARAM_EXPR_CHAR +
1988  1]; /*cut-out of expression to be parsed*/
1989  int scale_wh[NI_MAX_NUM_OF_DECODER_OUTPUTS][2];
1990  char sc_expr[NI_MAX_NUM_OF_DECODER_OUTPUTS][2]
1991  [NI_MAX_PPU_PARAM_EXPR_CHAR +
1992  1]; /*cut-out of expression to be parsed*/
1993  int keep_alive_timeout; /* keep alive timeout setting */
1994  // decoder lowDelay mode for All I packets or IPPP packets
1995  int decoder_low_delay;
1996  int enable_user_data_sei_passthru;
1997  int custom_sei_passthru;
1998 } ni_decoder_input_params_t;

2037 typedef struct _ni_frame
2038 {
2039  // codec of the source from which this frame is decoded
2040  ni_codec_format_t src_codec;
2041 
2042  long long dts;
2043  long long pts;
2044  uint32_t end_of_stream;
2045  uint32_t start_of_stream;
2046  uint32_t video_width;
2047  uint32_t video_height;
2048 
2049  uint32_t crop_top;
2050  uint32_t crop_bottom;
2051  uint32_t crop_left;
2052  uint32_t crop_right;
2053 
2054  // for encoder: force headers on this frame
2055  uint16_t force_headers;
2056  // for encoder: control long term reference picture feature
2057  uint8_t use_cur_src_as_long_term_pic;
2058  uint8_t use_long_term_ref;
2059 
2060  int force_key_frame;
2061  // for encoding: frame picture type sent to encoder
2062  // for decoding: frame picture type returned from decoder
2063  ni_pic_type_t ni_pict_type;
2064  // total SEI size: used by encoder
2065  unsigned int sei_total_len;
2066 
2067  // SEI info of closed caption: returned by decoder or set by encoder
2068  unsigned int sei_cc_offset;
2069  unsigned int sei_cc_len;
2070  // SEI info of HDR: returned by decoder
2071  unsigned int sei_hdr_mastering_display_color_vol_offset;
2072  unsigned int sei_hdr_mastering_display_color_vol_len;
2073  unsigned int sei_hdr_content_light_level_info_offset;
2074  unsigned int sei_hdr_content_light_level_info_len;
2075  // SEI info of HDR10+: returned by decoder
2076  unsigned int sei_hdr_plus_offset;
2077  unsigned int sei_hdr_plus_len;
2078  // SEI info of User Data Unregistered SEI: returned by decoder
2079  unsigned int sei_user_data_unreg_offset;
2080  unsigned int sei_user_data_unreg_len;
2081  // SEI info of alternative transfer characteristics: returned by decoder
2082  unsigned int sei_alt_transfer_characteristics_offset;
2083  unsigned int sei_alt_transfer_characteristics_len;
2084  // VUI info: returned by decoder
2085  unsigned int vui_offset;
2086  unsigned int vui_len;
2087 
2088  // ROI data length: for encoder
2089  unsigned int roi_len;
2090  // reconfig data length: for encoder
2091  unsigned int reconf_len;
2092  // total extra data data length: for encoder
2093  unsigned int extra_data_len;
2094  // force pic qp value
2095  uint16_t force_pic_qp;
2096  // frame chunk index
2097  uint32_t frame_chunk_idx;
2098 
2099  uint8_t *p_data[NI_MAX_NUM_DATA_POINTERS];
2100  uint32_t data_len[NI_MAX_NUM_DATA_POINTERS];
2101 
2102  uint8_t *p_buffer;
2103  uint32_t buffer_size;
2104 
2105  ni_buf_t
2106  *dec_buf; // buffer pool entry (has memory pointed to by p_buffer)
2107  uint8_t preferred_characteristics_data_len;
2108  int pixel_format;
2109 
2110  ni_custom_sei_set_t *p_custom_sei_set;
2111 
2112  // frame auxiliary data
2113  ni_aux_data_t *aux_data[NI_MAX_NUM_AUX_DATA_PER_FRAME];
2114  int nb_aux_data;
2115 
2116  // the following info is of the source stream that is returned by decoder:
2117  // color info, sample aspect ratio, timing etc that are useful at encoding.
2118  uint8_t color_primaries;
2119  uint8_t color_trc;
2120  uint8_t color_space;
2121  int video_full_range_flag;
2122  uint8_t aspect_ratio_idc;
2123  uint16_t sar_width;
2124  uint16_t sar_height;
2125  uint32_t vui_num_units_in_tick;
2126  uint32_t vui_time_scale;
2127 
2128  int flags; // flags of demuxed packet
2129 
2130  // for encoder: metadata buffer info if not contiguous with YUV
2131  uint8_t *p_metadata_buffer;
2132  uint32_t metadata_buffer_size;
2133  // for encoder: whether metadata should be sent separately for frame
2134  uint8_t separate_metadata;
2135 } ni_frame_t;
2136

2147  int source_width;
2148

2156  int force_pic_qp_demo_mode; // demo force pic qp mode - for internal testing

2161  // picture_order_count_type=2 in the H.264 SPS
2162 
2163  int dolby_vision_profile;
2164 
2165  // 1: force on every frame with same input type; 0: no (except for I-frame)

2170 
2171  int cacheRoi; // enables caching of ROIs applied to subsequent frames

2178  NI_DEPRECATED uint32_t pos_time_scale;

2195  // this supports max 50000 lines in reconfig file, max 10 key/values per line

2197  [NI_BITRATE_RECONFIG_FILE_MAX_ENTRIES_PER_LINE];

2200  ni_frame_t *p_first_frame;

2213  uint32_t ui32nodeAddress; //currently not in use, formerly offset
2214  int32_t device_handle; //handle to access device
2215  int8_t bit_depth; //1 == 8bit per pixel, 2 == 10bit
2216  int8_t encoding_type; //0 = semiplanar, 1 = semiplanar, 2 = tiled4x4
2217  int8_t output_idx; // 0-2 for decoder output index
