2295 /*!*****************************************************************************
2296  * \brief Allocate and initialize a new ni_session_context_t struct
2297  *
2298  *
2299  * \return On success returns a valid pointer to newly allocated context
2300  * On failure returns NULL
2301  ******************************************************************************/
2302 LIB_API ni_session_context_t *ni_device_session_context_alloc_init(void);
2303 
2304 /*!*****************************************************************************
2305  * \brief Initialize already allocated session context to a known state
2306  *
2307  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to an already allocated ni_session_context_t
2308  * struct
2309  *
2310  * \return On success
2311  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2312  * On failure
2313  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2314  * NI_RETCODE_FAILURE
2315  ******************************************************************************/
2316 LIB_API ni_retcode_t
2317 ni_device_session_context_init(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx);
2318 
2319 /*!*****************************************************************************
2320  * \brief Clear already allocated session context
2321  *
2322  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to an already allocated ni_session_context_t
2323  *
2324  *
2325  ******************************************************************************/
2326 LIB_API void ni_device_session_context_clear(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx);
2327 
2328 /*!*****************************************************************************
2329  * \brief Free previously allocated session context
2330  *
2331  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to an already allocated ni_session_context_t
2332  * struct
2333  *
2334  ******************************************************************************/
2335 LIB_API void ni_device_session_context_free(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx);
2336 
2337 /*!*****************************************************************************
2338  * \brief Create event and return event handle if successful (Windows only)
2339  *
2340  * \return On success returns a event handle
2341  * On failure returns NI_INVALID_EVENT_HANDLE
2342  ******************************************************************************/
2343 LIB_API ni_event_handle_t ni_create_event();
2344 
2345 /*!*****************************************************************************
2346  * \brief Close event and release resources (Windows only)
2347  *
2348  * \return NONE
2349  *
2350  ******************************************************************************/
2351 LIB_API void ni_close_event(ni_event_handle_t event_handle);
2352 
2353 /*!*****************************************************************************
2354  * \brief Open device and return device device_handle if successful
2355  *
2356  * \param[in] p_dev Device name represented as c string. ex: "/dev/nvme0"
2357  * \param[out] p_max_io_size_out Maximum IO Transfer size supported
2358  *
2359  * \return On success returns a device device_handle
2360  * On failure returns NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE
2361  ******************************************************************************/
2362 LIB_API ni_device_handle_t ni_device_open(const char *dev,
2363  uint32_t *p_max_io_size_out);
2364 
2365 /*!*****************************************************************************
2366  * \brief Close device and release resources
2367  *
2368  * \param[in] device_handle Device handle obtained by calling ni_device_open()
2369  *
2370  * \return NONE
2371  *
2372  ******************************************************************************/
2373 LIB_API void ni_device_close(ni_device_handle_t dev);
2374 
2375 /*!*****************************************************************************
2376  * \brief Query device and return device capability structure
2377  *
2378  * \param[in] device_handle Device handle obtained by calling ni_device_open
2379  * \param[in] p_cap Pointer to a caller allocated ni_device_capability_t
2380  * struct
2381  * \return On success
2382  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2383  * On failure
2384  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2385  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
2386  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
2387  ******************************************************************************/
2388 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_capability_query(
2389  ni_device_handle_t device_handle, ni_device_capability_t *p_cap);
2390 
2391 /*!*****************************************************************************
2392  * \brief Open a new device session depending on the device_type parameter
2393  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER opens decoding session
2394  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER opens encoding session
2395  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER opens scaling session
2396  *
2397  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
2398  * ni_session_context_t struct
2399  * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER,
2400  * or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER
2401  * \return On success
2402  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2403  * On failure
2404  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2405  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
2406  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
2407  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
2408  ******************************************************************************/
2409 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_session_open(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
2410  ni_device_type_t device_type);
2411 
2412 /*!*****************************************************************************
2413  * \brief Close device session that was previously opened by calling
2414  * ni_device_session_open()
2415  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER closes decoding session
2416  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER closes encoding session
2417  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER closes scaling session
2418  *
2419  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
2420  * ni_session_context_t struct
2421  * \param[in] eos_received Flag indicating if End Of Stream indicator was
2422  * received
2423  * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER,
2424  * or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER
2425  * \return On success
2426  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2427  * On failure
2428  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2429  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
2430  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
2431  ******************************************************************************/
2432 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_session_close(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
2433  int eos_received,
2434  ni_device_type_t device_type);
2435 
2436 /*!*****************************************************************************
2437  * \brief Send a flush command to the device
2438  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER sends flush command to
2439  * decoder
2440  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER sends flush command to
2441  * encoder
2442  *
2443  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
2444  * ni_session_context_t struct
2445  * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER
2446  * \return On success
2447  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2448  * On failure
2449  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2450  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
2451  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
2452  ******************************************************************************/
2453 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_session_flush(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
2454  ni_device_type_t device_type);
2455 
2456 /*!*****************************************************************************
2457  * \brief Save a stream's headers in a decoder session that can be used later
2458  * for continuous decoding from the same source.
2459  *
2460  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
2461  * ni_session_context_t struct
2462  * \param[in] hdr_data Pointer to header data
2463  * \param[in] hdr_size Size of header data in bytes
2464  * \return On success
2465  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2466  * On failure
2467  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2468  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
2469  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
2470  ******************************************************************************/
2471 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_dec_session_save_hdrs(
2472  ni_session_context_t *p_ctx, uint8_t *hdr_data, uint8_t hdr_size);
2473 
2474 /*!*****************************************************************************
2475  * \brief Flush a decoder session to get ready to continue decoding.
2476  * Note: this is different from ni_device_session_flush in that it closes the
2477  * current decode session and opens a new one for continuous decoding.
2478  *
2479  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
2480  * ni_session_context_t struct
2481  * \return On success
2482  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2483  * On failure
2484  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2485  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
2486  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
2487  ******************************************************************************/
2488 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_dec_session_flush(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx);
2489 
2490 /*!*****************************************************************************
2491  * \brief Send data to the device
2492  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER sends data packet to
2493  * decoder
2494  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER sends data frame to encoder
2495  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI sends data frame to AI engine
2496  *
2497  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
2498  * ni_session_context_t struct
2499  * \param[in] p_data Pointer to a caller allocated
2500  * ni_session_data_io_t struct which contains either a
2501  * ni_frame_t data frame or ni_packet_t data packet to
2502  * send
2503  * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER or
2504  * NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI
2505  * If NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER is specified, it is
2506  * expected that the ni_packet_t struct inside the
2507  * p_data pointer contains data to send.
2508  * If NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI is
2509  * specified, it is expected that the ni_frame_t
2510  * struct inside the p_data pointer contains data to
2511  * send.
2512  * \return On success
2513  * Total number of bytes written
2514  * On failure
2515  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2516  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
2517  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
2518  ******************************************************************************/
2519 LIB_API int ni_device_session_write(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
2520  ni_session_data_io_t *p_data,
2521  ni_device_type_t device_type);
2522 
2523 /*!*****************************************************************************
2524  * \brief Read data from the device
2525  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER reads data packet from
2526  * decoder
2527  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER reads data frame from
2528  * encoder
2529  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI reads data frame from AI engine
2530  *
2531  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
2532  * ni_session_context_t struct
2533  * \param[in] p_data Pointer to a caller allocated ni_session_data_io_t
2534  * struct which contains either a ni_frame_t data frame
2535  * or ni_packet_t data packet to send
2536  * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER, or
2537  * NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER
2538  * If NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER is specified, data that
2539  * was read will be placed into ni_frame_t struct
2540  * inside the p_data pointer
2541  * If NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER is specified, data that
2542  * was read will be placed into ni_packet_t struct
2543  * inside the p_data pointer
2544  * If NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI is specified, data that was
2545  * read will be placed into ni_frame_t struct inside
2546  * the p_data pointer
2547  * \return On success
2548  * Total number of bytes read
2549  * On failure
2550  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2551  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
2552  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
2553  ******************************************************************************/
2554 LIB_API int ni_device_session_read(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
2555  ni_session_data_io_t *p_data,
2556  ni_device_type_t device_type);
2557 
2558 /*!*****************************************************************************
2559  * \brief Query session data from the device -
2560  * If device_type is valid, will query session data
2561  * from specified device type
2562  *
2563  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
2564  * ni_session_context_t struct
2565  * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER or
2566  * NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER or
2567  * NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER or
2568  * NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI or
2569  * NI_DEVICE_TYPE_UPLOADER
2570  *
2571  * \return On success
2572  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2573  * On failure
2574  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2575  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
2576  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
2577  ******************************************************************************/
2578 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_session_query(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
2579  ni_device_type_t device_type);
2580 
2581 /*!*****************************************************************************
2582  * \brief Send namespace num and SRIOv index to the device with specified logic block
2583  * address.
2584  *
2585  * \param[in] device_handle Device handle obtained by calling ni_device_open
2586  * \param[in] namespace_num Set the namespace number with designated sriov
2587  * \param[in] sriov_index Identify which sriov need to be set
2588  *
2589  * \return On success
2590  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2591  * On failure
2592  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
2593  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
2594  ******************************************************************************/
2595 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_config_namespace_num(ni_device_handle_t device_handle,
2596  uint32_t namespace_num, uint32_t sriov_index);
2597 
2598 
2599 /*!*****************************************************************************
2600  * \brief Allocate preliminary memory for the frame buffer based on provided
2601  * parameters. Applicable to YUV420 Planar pixel (8 or 10 bit/pixel)
2602  * format or 32-bit RGBA.
2603  *
2604  * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to a caller allocated
2605  * ni_frame_t struct
2606  * \param[in] video_width Width of the video frame
2607  * \param[in] video_height Height of the video frame
2608  * \param[in] alignment Allignment requirement
2609  * \param[in] metadata_flag Flag indicating if space for additional metadata
2610  * should be allocated
2611  * \param[in] factor 1 for 8 bits/pixel format, 2 for 10 bits/pixel,
2612  * 4 for 32 bits/pixel (RGBA)
2613  * \param[in] hw_frame_count Number of hw descriptors stored in lieu of raw YUV
2614  * \param[in] is_planar 0 if semiplanar else planar
2615  *
2616  * \return On success
2617  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2618  * On failure
2619  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2620  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
2621  ******************************************************************************/
2622 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_frame_buffer_alloc(ni_frame_t *p_frame, int video_width,
2623  int video_height, int alignment,
2624  int metadata_flag, int factor,
2625  int hw_frame_count, int is_planar);
2626 
2627 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_frame_buffer_alloc_dl(ni_frame_t *p_frame,
2628  int video_width, int video_height,
2629  int pixel_format);
2630 
2631 /*!*****************************************************************************
2632  * \brief Allocate memory for decoder frame buffer based on provided
2633  * parameters; the memory is retrieved from a buffer pool and will be
2634  * returned to the same buffer pool by ni_decoder_frame_buffer_free.
2635  * Note: all attributes of ni_frame_t will be set up except for memory and
2636  * buffer, which rely on the pool being allocated; the pool will be
2637  * allocated only after the frame resolution is known.
2638  *
2639  * \param[in] p_pool Buffer pool to get the memory from
2640  * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to a caller allocated ni_frame_t struct
2641  * \param[in] alloc_mem Whether to get memory from buffer pool
2642  * \param[in] video_width Width of the video frame
2643  * \param[in] video_height Height of the video frame
2644  * \param[in] alignment Alignment requirement
2645  * \param[in] factor 1 for 8 bits/pixel format, 2 for 10 bits/pixel
2646  * \param[in] is_planar 0 if semiplanar else planar
2647  *
2648  * \return On success
2649  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2650  * On failure
2651  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2652  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
2653  ******************************************************************************/
2654 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_decoder_frame_buffer_alloc(
2655  ni_buf_pool_t *p_pool, ni_frame_t *pframe, int alloc_mem, int video_width,
2656  int video_height, int alignment, int factor, int is_planar);
2657 
2658 /*!*****************************************************************************
2659  * \brief Allocate memory for the frame buffer for encoding based on given
2660  * parameters, taking into account pic line size and extra data.
2661  * Applicable to YUV420p AVFrame only. 8 or 10 bit/pixel.
2662  * Cb/Cr size matches that of Y.
2663  *
2664  * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to a caller allocated ni_frame_t struct
2665  *
2666  * \param[in] video_width Width of the video frame
2667  * \param[in] video_height Height of the video frame
2668  * \param[in] linesize Picture line size
2669  * \param[in] alignment Allignment requirement
2670  * \param[in] extra_len Extra data size (incl. meta data). < 0 means not
2671  * to allocate any buffer (zero-copy from existing)
2672  * \param[in] alignment_2pass_wa set alignment to work with 2pass encode
2673  *
2674  * \return On success
2675  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2676  * On failure
2677  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2678  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
2679  *****************************************************************************/
2680 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_encoder_frame_buffer_alloc(
2681  ni_frame_t *pframe, int video_width, int video_height, int linesize[],
2682  int alignment, int extra_len, bool alignment_2pass_wa);
2683 
2684 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_scaler_dest_frame_alloc(
2685  ni_session_context_t *p_ctx, ni_scaler_input_params_t scaler_params,
2686  niFrameSurface1_t *p_surface);
2687 
2688 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_scaler_input_frame_alloc(
2689  ni_session_context_t *p_ctx, ni_scaler_input_params_t scaler_params,
2690  niFrameSurface1_t *p_src_surface);
2691 
2692 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_scaler_frame_pool_alloc(
2693  ni_session_context_t *p_ctx, ni_scaler_input_params_t scaler_params);
2694 
2695 /*!*****************************************************************************
2696 * \brief Allocate memory for the frame buffer based on provided parameters
2697 * taking into account pic line size and extra data.
2698 * Applicable to nv12 AVFrame only. Cb/Cr size matches that of Y.
2699 *
2700 * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to a caller allocated ni_frame_t struct
2701 *
2702 * \param[in] video_width Width of the video frame
2703 * \param[in] video_height Height of the video frame
2704 * \param[in] linesize Picture line size
2705 * \param[in] extra_len Extra data size (incl. meta data). < 0 means not
2706 * to allocate any buffer (zero-copy from existing)
2707 * \param[in] alignment_2pass_wa set alignment to work with 2pass encode
2708 *
2709 * \return On success
2710 * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2711 * On failure
2712 * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2713 * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
2714 *****************************************************************************/
2715 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_frame_buffer_alloc_nv(ni_frame_t *p_frame,
2716  int video_width, int video_height,
2717  int linesize[], int extra_len,
2718  bool alignment_2pass_wa);
2719 
2720 /*!*****************************************************************************
2721  * \brief This API is a wrapper for ni_encoder_frame_buffer_alloc(), used
2722  * for planar pixel formats, and ni_frame_buffer_alloc_nv(), used for
2723  * semi-planar pixel formats. This API is meant to combine the
2724  * functionality for both formats.
2725  * Allocate memory for the frame buffer for encoding based on given
2726  * parameters, taking into account pic line size and extra data.
2727  * Applicable to YUV420p(8 or 10 bit/pixel) or nv12 AVFrame.
2728  * Cb/Cr size matches that of Y.
2729  *
2730  * \param[in] planar true: if planar:
2731  * pixel_format == (NI_PIX_FMT_YUV420P ||
2732  * NI_PIX_FMT_YUV420P10LE ||NI_PIX_FMT_RGBA).
2733  * false: semi-planar:
2734  * pixel_format == (NI_PIX_FMT_NV12 ||
2735  * NI_PIX_FMT_P010LE).
2736  * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to a caller allocated ni_frame_t struct
2737  * \param[in] video_width Width of the video frame
2738  * \param[in] video_height Height of the video frame
2739  * \param[in] linesize Picture line size
2740  * \param[in] alignment Allignment requirement. Only used for planar format.
2741  * \param[in] extra_len Extra data size (incl. meta data). < 0 means not
2742  * to allocate any buffer (zero-copy from existing)
2743  * \param[in] alignment_2pass_wa set alignment to work with 2pass encode
2744  *
2745  * \return On success
2746  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2747  * On failure
2748  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2749  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
2750  *****************************************************************************/
2751 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_encoder_sw_frame_buffer_alloc(bool planar, ni_frame_t *p_frame,
2752  int video_width, int video_height,
2753  int linesize[], int alignment,
2754  int extra_len,
2755  bool alignment_2pass_wa);
2756 
2757 /*!*****************************************************************************
2758  * \brief Free frame buffer that was previously allocated with either
2759  * ni_frame_buffer_alloc or ni_encoder_frame_buffer_alloc or
2760  * ni_frame_buffer_alloc_nv
2761  *
2762  * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to a previously allocated ni_frame_t struct
2763  *
2764  * \return On success NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2765  * On failure NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2766  ******************************************************************************/
2767 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_frame_buffer_free(ni_frame_t *pframe);
2768 
2769 /*!*****************************************************************************
2770  * \brief Free decoder frame buffer that was previously allocated with
2771  * ni_decoder_frame_buffer_alloc, returning memory to a buffer pool.
2772  *
2773  * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to a previously allocated ni_frame_t struct
2774  *
2775  * \return On success NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2776  * On failure NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2777  ******************************************************************************/
2778 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_decoder_frame_buffer_free(ni_frame_t *pframe);
2779 
2780 /*!*****************************************************************************
2781  * \brief Return a memory buffer to memory buffer pool, for a decoder frame.
2782  *
2783  * \param[in] buf Buffer to be returned.
2784  * \param[in] p_buffer_pool Buffer pool to return buffer to.
2785  *
2786  * \return None
2787  ******************************************************************************/
2788 LIB_API void
2789 ni_decoder_frame_buffer_pool_return_buf(ni_buf_t *buf,
2790  ni_buf_pool_t *p_buffer_pool);
2791 
2792 /*!*****************************************************************************
2793  * \brief Allocate memory for the packet buffer based on provided packet size
2794  *
2795  * \param[in] p_packet Pointer to a caller allocated
2796  * ni_packet_t struct
2797  * \param[in] packet_size Required allocation size
2798  *
2799  * \return On success
2800  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2801  * On failure
2802  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2803  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
2804  ******************************************************************************/
2805 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_packet_buffer_alloc(ni_packet_t *ppacket,
2806  int packet_size);
2807 
2808 /*!*****************************************************************************
2809  * \brief Allocate packet buffer using a user provided pointer, the memory
2810  * is expected to have already been allocated.
2811  *
2812  * For ideal performance memory should be 4k aligned. If it is not 4K aligned
2813  * then a temporary 4k aligned memory will be used to copy data to and from
2814  * when writing and reading. This will negatively impact performance.
2815  *
2816  * This API will overwrite p_packet->buffer_size, p_packet->p_buffer and
2817  * p_packet->p_data fields in p_packet.
2818  *
2819  * This API will not free any memory associated with p_packet->p_buffer and
2820  * p_packet->p_data fields in p_packet.
2821  * Common use case could be,
2822  * 1. Allocate memory to pointer
2823  * 2. Call ni_custom_packet_buffer_alloc() with allocated pointer.
2824  * 3. Use p_packet as required.
2825  * 4. Call ni_packet_buffer_free() to free up the memory.
2826  *
2827  * \param[in] p_buffer User provided pointer to be used for buffer
2828  * \param[in] p_packet Pointer to a caller allocated
2829  * ni_packet_t struct
2830  * \param[in] buffer_size Buffer size
2831  *
2832  * \return On success
2833  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2834  * On failure
2835  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2836  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
2837  ******************************************************************************/
2838 ni_retcode_t ni_custom_packet_buffer_alloc(void *p_buffer,
2839  ni_packet_t *p_packet,
2840  int buffer_size);
2841 
2842 /*!*****************************************************************************
2843  * \brief Free packet buffer that was previously allocated with
2844  * ni_packet_buffer_alloc
2845  *
2846  * \param[in] p_packet Pointer to a previously allocated ni_packet_t struct
2847  *
2848  * \return On success NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2849  * On failure NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2850  ******************************************************************************/
2851 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_packet_buffer_free(ni_packet_t *ppacket);
2852 
2853 /*!*****************************************************************************
2854  * \brief Free packet buffer that was previously allocated with
2855  * ni_packet_buffer_alloc for AV1 packets merge
2856  *
2857  * \param[in] p_packet Pointer to a previously allocated ni_packet_t struct
2858  *
2859  * \return On success NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2860  * On failure NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2861  ******************************************************************************/
2862 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_packet_buffer_free_av1(ni_packet_t *ppacket);
2863 
2864 /*!*****************************************************************************
2865  * \brief Copy video packet accounting for alignment
2866  *
2867  * \param[in] p_destination Destination to where to copy to
2868  * \param[in] p_source Source from where to copy from
2869  * \param[in] cur_size current size
2870  * \param[out] p_leftover Pointer to the data that was left over
2871  * \param[out] p_prev_size Size of the data leftover
2872  *
2873  * \return On success Total number of bytes that were copied
2874  * On failure NI_RETCODE_FAILURE
2875  ******************************************************************************/
2876 LIB_API int ni_packet_copy(void *p_destination, const void *const p_source,
2877  int cur_size, void *p_leftover, int *p_prev_size);
2878 
2879 /*!*****************************************************************************
2880  * \brief Add a new auxiliary data to a frame
2881  *
2882  * \param[in/out] frame a frame to which the auxiliary data should be added
2883  * \param[in] type type of the added auxiliary data
2884  * \param[in] data_size size of the added auxiliary data
2885  *
2886  * \return a pointer to the newly added aux data on success, NULL otherwise
2887  ******************************************************************************/
2888 LIB_API ni_aux_data_t *ni_frame_new_aux_data(ni_frame_t *frame,
2889  ni_aux_data_type_t type,
2890  int data_size);
2891 
2892 /*!*****************************************************************************
2893  * \brief Add a new auxiliary data to a frame and copy in the raw data
2894  *
2895  * \param[in/out] frame a frame to which the auxiliary data should be added
2896  * \param[in] type type of the added auxiliary data
2897  * \param[in] raw_data the raw data of the aux data
2898  * \param[in] data_size size of the added auxiliary data
2899  *
2900  * \return a pointer to the newly added aux data on success, NULL otherwise
2901  ******************************************************************************/
2902 LIB_API ni_aux_data_t *
2903 ni_frame_new_aux_data_from_raw_data(ni_frame_t *frame, ni_aux_data_type_t type,
2904  const uint8_t *raw_data, int data_size);
2905 
2906 /*!*****************************************************************************
2907  * \brief Retrieve from the frame auxiliary data of a given type if exists
2908  *
2909  * \param[in] frame a frame from which the auxiliary data should be retrieved
2910  * \param[in] type type of the auxiliary data to be retrieved
2911  *
2912  * \return a pointer to the aux data of a given type on success, NULL otherwise
2913  ******************************************************************************/
2914 LIB_API ni_aux_data_t *ni_frame_get_aux_data(const ni_frame_t *frame,
2915  ni_aux_data_type_t type);
2916 
2917 /*!*****************************************************************************
2918  * \brief If auxiliary data of the given type exists in the frame, free it
2919  * and remove it from the frame.
2920  *
2921  * \param[in/out] frame a frame from which the auxiliary data should be removed
2922  * \param[in] type type of the auxiliary data to be removed
2923  *
2924  * \return None
2925  ******************************************************************************/
2926 LIB_API void ni_frame_free_aux_data(ni_frame_t *frame, ni_aux_data_type_t type);
2927 
2928 /*!*****************************************************************************
2929  * \brief Free and remove all auxiliary data from the frame.
2930  *
2931  * \param[in/out] frame a frame from which the auxiliary data should be removed
2932  *
2933  * \return None
2934  ******************************************************************************/
2935 LIB_API void ni_frame_wipe_aux_data(ni_frame_t *frame);
2936 
2937 /*!*****************************************************************************
2938  * \brief Initialize default encoder parameters
2939  *
2940  * \param[out] param Pointer to a user allocated ni_xcoder_params_t
2941  * to initialize to default parameters
2942  * \param[in] fps_num Frames per second
2943  * \param[in] fps_denom FPS denomination
2944  * \param[in] bit_rate bit rate
2945  * \param[in] width frame width
2946  * \param[in] height frame height
2947  * \param[in] codec_format codec from ni_codec_format_t
2948  *
2949  * \return On success
2950  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2951  * On failure
2952  * NI_RETCODE_FAILURE
2953  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2954  ******************************************************************************/
2955 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_encoder_init_default_params(
2956  ni_xcoder_params_t *p_param, int fps_num, int fps_denom, long bit_rate,
2957  int width, int height, ni_codec_format_t codec_format);
2958 
2959 /*!*****************************************************************************
2960  * \brief Initialize default decoder parameters
2961  *
2962  * \param[out] param Pointer to a user allocated ni_xcoder_params_t
2963  * to initialize to default parameters
2964  * \param[in] fps_num Frames per second
2965  * \param[in] fps_denom FPS denomination
2966  * \param[in] bit_rate bit rate
2967  * \param[in] width frame width
2968  * \param[in] height frame height
2969  *
2970  * \return On success
2971  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2972  * On failure
2973  * NI_RETCODE_FAILURE
2974  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2975  ******************************************************************************/
2976 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_decoder_init_default_params(ni_xcoder_params_t *p_param,
2977  int fps_num, int fps_denom,
2978  long bit_rate, int width,
2979  int height);
2980 
2981 /*!*****************************************************************************
2982  * \brief Set value referenced by name in encoder parameters structure
2983  *
2984  * \param[in] p_params Pointer to a user allocated ni_xcoder_params_t
2985  * to find and set a particular parameter
2986  * \param[in] name String represented parameter name to search
2987  * \param[in] value Parameter value to set
2988 *
2989  * \return On success
2990  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2991  * On failure
2992  * NI_RETCODE_FAILURE
2993  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2994  ******************************************************************************/
2995 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_encoder_params_set_value(ni_xcoder_params_t *p_params,
2996  const char *name,
2997  const char *value);
2998 
2999 /*!*****************************************************************************
3000 * \brief Set value referenced by name in decoder parameters structure
3001 *
3002 * \param[in] p_params Pointer to a user allocated ni_xcoder_params_t (used
3003 * for decoder too for now ) to find and set a particular
3004 * parameter
3005 * \param[in] name String represented parameter name to search
3006 * \param[in] value Parameter value to set
3007 *
3008 * \return On success
3009 * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
3010 * On failure
3011 * NI_RETCODE_FAILURE
3012 * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3013 ******************************************************************************/
3014 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_decoder_params_set_value(ni_xcoder_params_t *p_params,
3015  const char *name, char *value);
3016 
3017 /*!*****************************************************************************
3018  * \brief Set GOP parameter value referenced by name in encoder parameters
3019  * structure
3020  *
3021  * \param[in] p_params Pointer to a user allocated ni_xcoder_params_t
3022  * to find and set a particular parameter
3023  * \param[in] name String represented parameter name to search
3024  * \param[in] value Parameter value to set
3025 *
3026  * \return On success
3027  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
3028  * On failure
3029  * NI_RETCODE_FAILURE
3030  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3031  ******************************************************************************/
3032 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_encoder_gop_params_set_value(
3033  ni_xcoder_params_t *p_params, const char *name, const char *value);
3034 
3035 /*!*****************************************************************************
3036 * \brief Copy existing decoding session params for hw frame usage
3037 *
3038 * \param[in] src_p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated source session context
3039 * \param[in] dst_p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated destination session
3040 * context
3041 * \return On success
3042 * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
3043 * On failure
3044 * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3045 ******************************************************************************/
3046 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_session_copy(ni_session_context_t *src_p_ctx,
3047  ni_session_context_t *dst_p_ctx);
3048 
3049 /*!*****************************************************************************
3050 * \brief Send frame pool setup info to device
3051 *
3052 * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
3053 * ni_session_context_t struct
3054 * \param[in] pool_size Upload session initial allocated frames count
3055 * must be > 0,
3056 * \param[in] pool 0 use the normal pool
3057 * 1 use a dedicated P2P pool
3058 *
3059 * \return On success Return code
3060 * On failure
3061 * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3062 * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
3063 * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
3064 * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
3065 ******************************************************************************/
3066 LIB_API int ni_device_session_init_framepool(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
3067  uint32_t pool_size, uint32_t pool);
3068 
3069 /*!*****************************************************************************
3070 * \brief Read data from the device
3071 * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER reads data hwdesc from
3072 * decoder
3073 * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER reads data hwdesc from
3074 * scaler
3075 *
3076 * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
3077 * ni_session_context_t struct
3078 * \param[in] p_data Pointer to a caller allocated
3079 * ni_session_data_io_t struct which contains either a
3080 * ni_frame_t data frame or ni_packet_t data packet to
3081 * send
3082 * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER
3083 * If NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER is specified,
3084 * hw descriptor info will be stored in p_data ni_frame
3085 * \return On success
3086 * Total number of bytes read
3087 * On failure
3088 * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3089 * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
3090 * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
3091 ******************************************************************************/
3092 LIB_API int ni_device_session_read_hwdesc(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
3093  ni_session_data_io_t *p_data,
3094  ni_device_type_t device_type);
3095 
3096 /*!*****************************************************************************
3097 * \brief Read YUV data from hw descriptor stored location on device
3098 *
3099 * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
3100 * ni_session_context_t struct
3101 * \param[in] p_data Pointer to a caller allocated
3102 * ni_session_data_io_t struct which contains either a
3103 * ni_frame_t data frame or ni_packet_t data packet to
3104 * send
3105 * \param[in] hwdesc HW descriptor to find frame in XCODER
3106 * \return On success
3107 * Total number of bytes read
3108 * On failure
3109 * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3110 * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
3111 * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
3112 ******************************************************************************/
3113 LIB_API int ni_device_session_hwdl(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
3114  ni_session_data_io_t *p_data,
3115  niFrameSurface1_t *hwdesc);
3116 
3117 /*!*****************************************************************************
3118 * \brief Send raw YUV input to uploader instance and retrieve a HW descriptor
3119 * to represent it
3120 *
3121 * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
3122 * ni_session_context_t struct
3123 * \param[in] p_src_data Pointer to a caller allocated
3124 * ni_session_data_io_t struct which contains a
3125 * ni_frame_t data frame to send to uploader
3126 * \param[out] hwdesc HW descriptor to find frame in XCODER
3127 * \return On success
3128 * Total number of bytes read
3129 * On failure
3130 * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3131 * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
3132 * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
3133 *******************************************************************************/
3134 LIB_API int ni_device_session_hwup(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx, ni_session_data_io_t *p_src_data, niFrameSurface1_t* hwdesc);
3135 
3136 /*!*****************************************************************************
3137 * \brief Allocate memory for the hwDescriptor buffer based on provided
3138 * parameters taking into account pic size and extra data.
3139 *
3140 * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to a caller allocated ni_frame_t struct
3141 *
3142 * \param[in] video_width Width of the video frame
3143 * \param[in] video_height Height of the video frame
3144 * \param[in] extra_len Extra data size (incl. meta data)
3145 *
3146 * \return On success
3147 * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
3148 * On failure
3149 * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3150 * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
3151 *****************************************************************************/
3152 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_frame_buffer_alloc_hwenc(ni_frame_t *pframe,
3153  int video_width,
3154  int video_height,
3155  int extra_len);
3156 
3157 /*!*****************************************************************************
3158 * \brief Recycle a frame buffer on card
3159 *
3160 * \param[in] surface Struct containing device and frame location to clear out
3161 * \param[in] device_handle handle to access device memory buffer is stored in
3162 *
3163 * \return On success NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
3164 * On failure NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3165 *******************************************************************************/
3166 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_hwframe_buffer_recycle(niFrameSurface1_t *surface,
3167  int32_t device_handle);
3168 
3169 /*!*****************************************************************************
3170  * \brief Set parameters on the device for the 2D engine
3171  *
3172  * \param[in] p_ctx pointer to session context
3173  * \param[in] p_params pointer to the scaler parameters
3174  *
3175  * \return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3176  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
3177  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
3178 
3179  ******************************************************************************/
3180 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_scaler_set_params(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
3181  ni_scaler_params_t *p_params);
3182 
3183 /*!*****************************************************************************
3184  * \brief Allocate a frame on the device for 2D engine or AI engine
3185  * to work on based on provided parameters
3186  *
3187  * \param[in] p_ctx pointer to session context
3188  * \param[in] width width, in pixels
3189  * \param[in] height height, in pixels
3190  * \param[in] format pixel format
3191  * \param[in] options options bitmap flags, bit 0 (NI_SCALER_FLAG_IO) is
3192  * 0=input frame or 1=output frame. Bit 1 (NI_SCALER_FLAG_PC) is
3193  * 0=single allocation, 1=create pool. Bit 2 (NI_SCALER_FLAG_PA) is
3194  * 0=straight alpha, 1=premultiplied alpha
3195  * \param[in] rectangle_width clipping rectangle width
3196  * \param[in] rectangle_height clipping rectangle height
3197  * \param[in] rectangle_x horizontal position of clipping rectangle
3198  * \param[in] rectangle_y vertical position of clipping rectangle
3199  * \param[in] rgba_color RGBA fill colour (for padding only)
3200  * \param[in] frame_index input hwdesc index
3201  * \param[in] device_type only NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER
3202  * and NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI (only needs p_ctx and frame_index)
3203  *
3204  * \return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3205  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
3206  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
3207  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
3208  ******************************************************************************/
3209 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_alloc_frame(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx,
3210  int width,
3211  int height,
3212  int format,
3213  int options,
3214  int rectangle_width,
3215  int rectangle_height,
3216  int rectangle_x,
3217  int rectangle_y,
3218  int rgba_color,
3219  int frame_index,
3220  ni_device_type_t device_type);
3221 
3222 /*!*****************************************************************************
3223  * \brief Config a frame on the device for 2D engined
3224  * to work on based on provided parameters
3225  *
3226  * \param[in] p_ctx pointer to session context
3227  * \param[in] p_cfg pointer to frame config
3228  *
3229  * \return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3230  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
3231  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
3232  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
3233  ******************************************************************************/
3234 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_config_frame(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
3235  ni_frame_config_t *p_cfg);
3236

3238  ni_scaler_drawbox_params_t *p_params);

3240 /*!*****************************************************************************

3242  * to work on based on provided parameters
3243  *

3246  * \param[in] numInCfgs number of frame config entries in the p_cfg_in array
3247  * \param[in] p_cfg_out output frame config
3248  *
3249  * \return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3250  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
3251  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
3252  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
3253  ******************************************************************************/
3254 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_multi_config_frame(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
3255  ni_frame_config_t p_cfg_in[],
3256  int numInCfgs,
3257  ni_frame_config_t *p_cfg_out);
3258 
3259 /*!*****************************************************************************
3260  * \brief Allocate memory for the frame buffer based on provided parameters
3261  * taking into account the pixel format, width, height, stride,
3262  * alignment, and extra data
3263  * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to caller allocated ni_frame_t
3264  * \param[in] pixel_format a pixel format in ni_pix_fmt_t enum
3265  * \param[in] video_width width, in pixels
3266  * \param[in] video_height height, in pixels
3267  * \param[in] linesize horizontal stride
3268  * \param[in] alignment apply a 16 pixel height alignment (T408 only)
3269  * \param[in] extra_len meta data size
3270  *
3271  * \return NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
3272  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3273  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
3274  *
3275  ******************************************************************************/
3276 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_frame_buffer_alloc_pixfmt(
3277  ni_frame_t *pframe, int pixel_format, int video_width, int video_height,
3278  int linesize[], int alignment, int extra_len);
3279

3492 /*!*****************************************************************************

3494  *

3496  * [in] p_enc_params pointer to encoder parameters
3497  * [in] width input width
3498  * [in] height input height
3499  * [in] bit_depth 8 for 8-bit YUV, 10 for 10-bit YUV
3500  * [in] src_endian NI_FRAME_LITTLE_ENDIAN or NI_FRAME_BIG_ENDIAN
3501  * [in] planar 0 for semi-planar YUV, 1 for planar YUV
3502  *

3505  *
3506  * on failure
3507  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3508 *******************************************************************************/

3511  int width, int height, int bit_depth, int src_endian, int planar);

3550 /*!*****************************************************************************

3557  * receive

3569 /*!*****************************************************************************
3570  * \brief Get the DMA buffer file descriptor from the P2P frame
3571  *

3573  *
3574  * \return On success
3575  * DMA buffer file descriptor

3578 *******************************************************************************/
3579 LIB_API int32_t ni_get_dma_buf_file_descriptor(const ni_frame_t* p_frame);
3580 
3581 
3582 /*!*****************************************************************************
3583  * \brief Send sequence change information to device
3584  *
3585  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
3586  * ni_session_context_t struct
3587  * \param[in] width input width
3588  * \param[in] height input height
3589  * \param[in] bit_depth_factor 1 for 8-bit YUV, 2 for 10-bit YUV
3590  * \param[in] device_type device type (must be encoder)
3591  * \return On success
3592  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
3593  * On failure
3594  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3595  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
3596  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
3597  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
3598  ******************************************************************************/
3599 LIB_API ni_retcode_t ni_device_session_sequence_change(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
3600  int width, int height, int bit_depth_factor, ni_device_type_t device_type);
3601 
3602 #ifdef __cplusplus
3603 }
3604 #endif
